title: Two blocks with lightweight string and pulley

content.question: Two identical blocks are connected by a lightweight string that passes over a lightweight pulley that can rotate about its axle with negligible friction. The two-block system is released from rest and the blocks accelerate. Which of the following correctly relates the potential energy gained by the block 1-Earth system <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> to the potential energy lost by the block 2-Earth system <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math> and provides correct evidence?

choices.label: <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1, equals the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, because both blocks travel the same distance.

<math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1, equals the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, because both blocks gain the same amount of kinetic energy.

<math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1, is less than the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo><mo><</mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, because the two-block system gains kinetic energy.

<math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1, is less than the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded><mo><</mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, because the tension exerted on block 1 by the string is less than the tension exerted on block 2 by the string.

content.answer: <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U sub 1, is less than the absolute value of delta U sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo><mo><</mo><mpadded><mo>|</mo><mpadded><mo>∆</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mpadded><mo>|</mo></mpadded></math>, because the two-block system gains kinetic energy.
